FuncDef:
The acl ipv6-pool command creates an ACL IPv6 address pool and enters the ACL IPv6 address pool view.
The undo acl ipv6-pool command deletes an ACL IPv6 address pool.
By default, no ACL IPv6 address pool is created on the device.

ParaDef.Info:
Specifies the name of an ACL IPv6 address pool.
The value is a string of 1 to 32 case-sensitive characters, spaces not supported. The value can be any combination of letters, digits, dots (.), or underscores (_).

ExtraInfo:
Usage Scenario
In typical ACL6 usage scenarios such as QoS or security service, to filter traffic based on the source IPv6 addresses of BGP peers, run the acl ipv6-pool command to create an ACL IPv6 address pool.
Follow-up Procedure
Run the apply bgp-peer command to associate IPv6 addresses of BGP peers with the ACL IPv6 address pool.
Precautions
Currently, the device only supports IPv6 address pools for advance ACLs.
